basics.name: Marc Desgroseilliers
basics.label: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Data scientist with a strong background in statistics and numerical computing. Keen to apply new machine learning methods to real world problems.

work.name: Inpher
work.summary: Develop and implement algorithms in the setting of the multiparty computations.
highlights: Design and adapt machine learning algorithms for cryptographical frameworks
Analyze and validate numerical precision of privacy preserving algorithms

work.name: UPC
work.summary: Use data collected by end users' modems to improve network availability and health.
highlights: Fault detection in the internet distribution network (hybrid fiber coaxial)
Manage and promote the CPD detection project, from exploratory data analysis to machine learning algorithm selection to deployment
Generate visualizations and reports to help business partners and engineers better understand network status

work.name: Pix4D
work.summary: Promote the use of photogrammetry software
highlights: Created a training program: workshops, educational videos, online material
Troubleshoot user issues, specialization in precision agriculture and multispectral imagery
Managed the elaboration of an online certification program
Liaised between technical and non technical team member

education.institution: Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne EPFL

education.studyType: Erasmus Mundus Masters: Algebra, Geometry and Number Theory

publications.name: XORBoost: Tree Boosting in the Multiparty Computation Setting
Reducing Randomness in Matrix Models for Wireless Communication
Partially random matrices in line-of-sight wireless networks

projects.name: XorBoost
projects.description: Xgboost in the multiparty computation setting
highlights: First implementation of a fully privacy preserving MPC version of tree learning
Able to handle datasets with hundreds of features and millions of rows

projects.name: DataFrames
projects.description: Framework to write algorithms chaining local and multiparty computations
highlights: Implementation of Join and Groupby in a privacy preserving setting
Design of an API to give users flexibility to port their data science workflow while hiding the complexity inherent with MPC computations
